newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRA-Australia labor disputes fall in July.
newsitem.headline: RTRA-Australia labor disputes fall in July.

text.p: The number of Australian labour disputes fell in July to 43 from 52 in June, the Australian Bureau of Statistics said on Friday.
But the total number of working days lost due to industrial disputes increased three percent to 137,300 from 133,400.
The construction industry was the worst-hit sector, losing 56,100 working days, or 41 percent of all days lost in July, the bureau said.

"Significant increases and high levels of disputation were also evident in coal mining (33,100) and Other industries (predominantly government administration and defence) which reported 25,000 working days lost," the bureau said.
The latest figure is a substantial increase over the same month last year, when just 36,500 working days were lost from 69 disputes.
The number of working days lost in the fiscal year to June 30 increased dramatically over the previous year to 899,600, compared with 580,300 in 1994/95, the bureau said.

But the number of disputes fell to 563 from 651, the bureau said. More than half the working days lost in 1995/96 occurred in just two industries -- construction, which lost 286,900 days, and education, health and community services, which lost 234,200 days.
